meanings.definition: A person or machine that separates a mixture into its component parts.
meanings.sent1: The fractionators in the factory work tirelessly to separate the different substances.
meanings.sent2: The fractionators efficiently separate the oil and water in the mixture.
meanings.sent3: The fractionators decided to go on strike, leaving the mixture all mixed up!
meanings.sent4: She was like a fractionator, carefully dividing her time between work and family.
meanings.sent5: The fractionators hummed and whirred, creating a symphony of separation.

meanings.definition: The process of separating a mixture into its component parts.
meanings.sent1: The fractionators completed the separation of the mixture in record time.
meanings.sent2: The fractionators' job is crucial in ensuring the purity of the final products.
meanings.sent3: The fractionators threw a party to celebrate successfully completing the separation process.
meanings.sent4: The fractionators worked together like a well-oiled machine to achieve perfect separation.
meanings.sent5: The fractionators' precision in the separation process was unmatched.
